trans-unit.source: This article describes how to use the CameraCaptureUI class to capture photos or videos using the camera UI built into Windows.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to use the CameraCaptureUI class to capture photos or videos using the camera UI built into Windows.

trans-unit.source: Capture photos and video with CameraCaptureUI
trans-unit.target: Capture photos and video with CameraCaptureUI

trans-unit.source: Capture photos and video with CameraCaptureUI
trans-unit.target: Capture photos and video with CameraCaptureUI

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to use the CameraCaptureUI class to capture photos or videos using the camera UI built into Windows.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to use the CameraCaptureUI class to capture photos or videos using the camera UI built into Windows.

trans-unit.source: This feature is easy to use and allows your app to get a user-captured photo or video with just a few lines of code.
trans-unit.target: This feature is easy to use and allows your app to get a user-captured photo or video with just a few lines of code.

trans-unit.source: If your scenario requires more robust, low-level control of the capture operation, you should use the [**MediaCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241124) object and implement your own capture experience.
trans-unit.target: If your scenario requires more robust, low-level control of the capture operation, you should use the [**MediaCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241124) object and implement your own capture experience.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Capture photos and video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Capture photos and video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md).

trans-unit.source: Capture a photo with CameraCaptureUI
trans-unit.target: Capture a photo with CameraCaptureUI

trans-unit.source: To use the camera capture UI, include the [**Windows.Media.Capture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226738) namespace in your project.
trans-unit.target: To use the camera capture UI, include the [**Windows.Media.Capture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226738) namespace in your project.

trans-unit.source: To do file operations with the returned image file, include [**Windows.Storage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227346).
trans-unit.target: To do file operations with the returned image file, include [**Windows.Storage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227346).

trans-unit.source: UsingCaptureUI
trans-unit.target: UsingCaptureUI

trans-unit.source: To capture a photo, create a new [**CameraCaptureUI**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241030) object.
trans-unit.target: To capture a photo, create a new [**CameraCaptureUI**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241030) object.

trans-unit.source: Using the object's [**PhotoSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241058) property you can specify properties for the returned photo such as the image format of the photo.
trans-unit.target: Using the object's [**PhotoSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241058) property you can specify properties for the returned photo such as the image format of the photo.

trans-unit.source: By default, the camera capture UI allows the user to crop the photo before it is returned, although this can be disabled with the [**AllowCropping**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241042) property.
trans-unit.target: By default, the camera capture UI allows the user to crop the photo before it is returned, although this can be disabled with the [**AllowCropping**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241042) property.

trans-unit.source: This example sets the [**CroppedSizeInPixels**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241044) to request that the returned image be 200 x 200 in pixels.
trans-unit.target: This example sets the [**CroppedSizeInPixels**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241044) to request that the returned image be 200 x 200 in pixels.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Imaging cropping in the CameraCaptureUI is not supported for devices in the Mobile device family.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Imaging cropping in the CameraCaptureUI is not supported for devices in the Mobile device family.

trans-unit.source: The value of the [**AllowCropping**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241042) property is ignored when your app is running on these devices.
trans-unit.target: The value of the [**AllowCropping**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241042) property is ignored when your app is running on these devices.

trans-unit.source: Call [**CaptureFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241057) and specify [**CameraCaptureUIMode.Photo**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241040) to specify that a photo should be captured.
trans-unit.target: Call [**CaptureFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241057) and specify [**CameraCaptureUIMode.Photo**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241040) to specify that a photo should be captured.

trans-unit.source: The method returns a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) instance containing the image if the capture is successful.
trans-unit.target: The method returns a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) instance containing the image if the capture is successful.

trans-unit.source: If the user cancels the capture, the returned object is null.
trans-unit.target: If the user cancels the capture, the returned object is null.

trans-unit.source: CapturePhoto
trans-unit.target: CapturePhoto

trans-unit.source: Once you have the **StorageFile** containing the captured photo, you can create a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) object that can be used with several different Universal Windows app features.
trans-unit.target: Once you have the **StorageFile** containing the captured photo, you can create a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) object that can be used with several different Universal Windows app features.

trans-unit.source: First you should include the [**Windows.Graphics.Imaging**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226400) namespace in your project.
trans-unit.target: First you should include the [**Windows.Graphics.Imaging**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226400) namespace in your project.

trans-unit.source: UsingSoftwareBitmap
trans-unit.target: UsingSoftwareBitmap

trans-unit.source: Call [**OpenAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227116) to get a stream from the image file.
trans-unit.target: Call [**OpenAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227116) to get a stream from the image file.

trans-unit.source: Call [**BitmapDecoder.CreateAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226182) to get a bitmap decoder for the stream.
trans-unit.target: Call [**BitmapDecoder.CreateAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226182) to get a bitmap decoder for the stream.

trans-unit.source: Then call [**GetSoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887332) to get a **SoftwareBitmap** representation of the image.
trans-unit.target: Then call [**GetSoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887332) to get a **SoftwareBitmap** representation of the image.

trans-unit.source: SoftwareBitmap
trans-unit.target: SoftwareBitmap

trans-unit.source: To display the image in your UI, declare an [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242752) control in your XAML page.
trans-unit.target: To display the image in your UI, declare an [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242752) control in your XAML page.

trans-unit.source: ImageControl
trans-unit.target: ImageControl

trans-unit.source: To use the software bitmap in your XAML page, include the using [**Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Imaging**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243258) namespace in your project.
trans-unit.target: To use the software bitmap in your XAML page, include the using [**Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Imaging**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243258) namespace in your project.

trans-unit.source: UsingSoftwareBitmapSource
trans-unit.target: UsingSoftwareBitmapSource

trans-unit.source: The **Image** control requires that the image source be in BGRA8 format with premultiplied alpha or no alpha, so call the static method [**SoftwareBitmap.Convert**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887362) to create a new software bitmap with the desired format.
trans-unit.target: The **Image** control requires that the image source be in BGRA8 format with premultiplied alpha or no alpha, so call the static method [**SoftwareBitmap.Convert**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887362) to create a new software bitmap with the desired format.

trans-unit.source: Next, create a new [**SoftwareBitmapSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997854) object and call [**SetBitmapAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997856) to assign the software bitmap to the source.
trans-unit.target: Next, create a new [**SoftwareBitmapSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997854) object and call [**SetBitmapAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997856) to assign the software bitmap to the source.

trans-unit.source: Finally, set the **Image** control's [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242760) property to display the captured photo in the UI.
trans-unit.target: Finally, set the **Image** control's [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242760) property to display the captured photo in the UI.

trans-unit.source: SetImageSource
trans-unit.target: SetImageSource

trans-unit.source: Capture a video with CameraCaptureUI
trans-unit.target: Capture a video with CameraCaptureUI

trans-unit.source: To capture a video, create a new [**CameraCaptureUI**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241030) object.
trans-unit.target: To capture a video, create a new [**CameraCaptureUI**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241030) object.

trans-unit.source: Using the object's [**VideoSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241059) property you can specify properties for the returned video such as the format of the video.
trans-unit.target: Using the object's [**VideoSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241059) property you can specify properties for the returned video such as the format of the video.

trans-unit.source: Call [**CaptureFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241057) and specify [**Video**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241059) to specify that a video should be capture.
trans-unit.target: Call [**CaptureFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241057) and specify [**Video**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241059) to specify that a video should be capture.

trans-unit.source: The method returns a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) instance containing the video if the capture is successful.
trans-unit.target: The method returns a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) instance containing the video if the capture is successful.

trans-unit.source: If the user cancels the capture, the returned object is null.
trans-unit.target: If the user cancels the capture, the returned object is null.

trans-unit.source: CaptureVideo
trans-unit.target: CaptureVideo

trans-unit.source: What you do with the captured video file depends on the scenario for your app.
trans-unit.target: What you do with the captured video file depends on the scenario for your app.

trans-unit.source: The rest of this article shows you how to quickly create a media composition from one or more captured videos and show it in your UI.
trans-unit.target: The rest of this article shows you how to quickly create a media composition from one or more captured videos and show it in your UI.

trans-unit.source: First, add a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) control in which the video composition will be displayed to your XAML page.
trans-unit.target: First, add a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) control in which the video composition will be displayed to your XAML page.

trans-unit.source: MediaElement
trans-unit.target: MediaElement

trans-unit.source: Add the [**Windows.Media.Editing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640565) and [**Windows.Media.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278962) namespaces to your project.
trans-unit.target: Add the [**Windows.Media.Editing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640565) and [**Windows.Media.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278962) namespaces to your project.

trans-unit.source: UsingMediaComposition
trans-unit.target: UsingMediaComposition

trans-unit.source: Declare member variables for a [**MediaComposition**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652646) object and a [**MediaStreamSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn282716) that you want to stay in scope for the lifetime of the page.
trans-unit.target: Declare member variables for a [**MediaComposition**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652646) object and a [**MediaStreamSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn282716) that you want to stay in scope for the lifetime of the page.

trans-unit.source: DeclareMediaComposition
trans-unit.target: DeclareMediaComposition

trans-unit.source: Once, before you capture any videos, you should create a new instance of the **MediaComposition** class.
trans-unit.target: Once, before you capture any videos, you should create a new instance of the **MediaComposition** class.

trans-unit.source: InitComposition
trans-unit.target: InitComposition

trans-unit.source: With the video file returned from the camera capture UI, create a new [**MediaClip**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652596) by calling [**MediaClip.CreateFromFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652607).
trans-unit.target: With the video file returned from the camera capture UI, create a new [**MediaClip**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652596) by calling [**MediaClip.CreateFromFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652607).

trans-unit.source: Add the media clip to the composition's [**Clips**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652648) collection.
trans-unit.target: Add the media clip to the composition's [**Clips**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652648) collection.

trans-unit.source: Call [**GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652674) to create the **MediaStreamSource** object from the composition.
trans-unit.target: Call [**GeneratePreviewMediaStreamSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652674) to create the **MediaStreamSource** object from the composition.

trans-unit.source: AddToComposition
trans-unit.target: AddToComposition

trans-unit.source: Finally, set the stream source to using the media element's [**SetMediaStreamSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn299029) method to show the composition in the UI.
trans-unit.target: Finally, set the stream source to using the media element's [**SetMediaStreamSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn299029) method to show the composition in the UI.

trans-unit.source: SetMediaElementSource
trans-unit.target: SetMediaElementSource

trans-unit.source: You can continue to capture video clips and add them to the composition.
trans-unit.target: You can continue to capture video clips and add them to the composition.

trans-unit.source: For more information on media compositions, see [Media compositions and editing](media-compositions-and-editing.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on media compositions, see [Media compositions and editing](media-compositions-and-editing.md).

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
